page.title: 16Titchfield Carnival Time
page.content:
Early November is the time for bonfires and fireworks.Up and down the country ,in towns and villages alike. Crowds of people gather in the streets ,gardens and open spaces to remember the 5th November.This is Guy Fawlkes Day ,when the bonfires and fireworks recall the unsuccessful attempt by Fawlkes and his accomplices to destroy the Houses of Parliament in 1605.In some places the jollifications are planned on an especially big scale and one of these is the Hampshire village of Titchfield 10 miles south-east of Southampton.
Every year on Monday nearest to the 5th of November, Titchfield holds a carnival which has flourished for about 90 years one of the best of its kind in the south.The carnival is organised by the Titchfield Bonfireboy
